projects.name: BudCode
descriptionLines: There is a lack of access for resume builders (e.g. college students and new grads) to gain experience working in software development group environments. Not everyone has the network to work with others, so finding new people to work with will help all parties grow and gain more experience. This will also help these developers in landing job opportunities due to how important previous projects are for employers, especially projects done in team environments.
BudCode is an online platform that allows software developers, at any level (novice students to seasoned professionals), to connect and collaborate.
I primarily worked on the REST API, but assisted the frontend team where necessary.
projects.note: When visiting the site, it may take some time for the first request to process, especially when the site hasn't been visited in a while. Being in the free tier comes with a price.

projects.name: Sylica
projects.description: Sylica is an e-commerce platform for electronic devices. I primarily worked on the frontend service of the application.
projects.note: When visiting the site, it may take some time for the first request to process, especially when the site hasn't been visited in a while. Being in the free tier comes with a price.

projects.name: Gamedia
projects.description: A social media site for gamers
projects.note: The repo contains both the client and server applications, but I worked solely on the REST API.

projects.name: Collegefulbar
descriptionLines: My teammate and I noticed first-hand the many issues there are with course enrollment sites for colleges and universities such as CUNYFirst. We aimed to solve these issues by creating our own platform.

Collegefulbar is a basic student management system for colleges and universities where students and instructors can manage their classes effortlessly and administrators can manage courses, classes, students, and more.
projects.note: The repo contains both frontend and backend code, but I worked solely on the backend portion in dealing with the database.

projects.name: Instagram Insights [EOL]
descriptionLines: Instagram allows users to download their data. However, the data itself can't provide meaningful information without an application or tool.
Instagram Insights uses account data to reveal insights of a user's Instagram account.
projects.note: Instagram has updated the structure of its data files and this tool isn't updated to work with the new structure.

projects.name: artificial-intelligence
projects.description: Coursework for CSc 44800 - Artificial Intelligence at The City College of New York Spring 2022

projects.name: NeuralNetworkLAndH
projects.description: Array-based neural network for identifying characters L and H

projects.name: Brindle
descriptionLines: This project was my team's submission for HackCooper2019. For most of us, it was our first hackathon.

Our idea was to create a website that converts books written in English to books written in braille and contains a library of books already written in braille. In order to do this, we created braille translators (one in C++ and the other in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS).
These translators simply convert user input in English to Grade 2 Braille.

projects.name: GroupMaker
descriptionLines: During my time at All Star Code, we were often being placed in groups, and I noticed it could be done more easily.
I created this program that converts a list of names from user input to random groups based on user preference.
projects.note: This was basically my first ever project.

descriptionLines: After all, this website is a project, too.
